channel.title: The Carmen Murray Show
channel.copyright: © Solid Gold Studios - all rights reserved
channel.description:
Are you looking to broaden your horizons, to stay relevant and become Future Fit? Do you want to fuel your creativity and inspire Innovation? or… are you simply looking to put the “kapow” back into your business? Then look no further. Join Carmen Murray, Entrepreneur, Innovator and Tech Fundi, with her big personality and presentation style, as she interviews celebrities, alchemist, news-makers and business experts to discover the stories behind their success. The Carmen Murray Show will open your mind and help you turn knowledge into magic. Let knowledge be your Super Power!

Visit Boo-Yah.co.za to learn more about our training workshops designed to get you #TechFit # SkillsFit #InnovationFit #TrendFit and #MarketingFit

To book for the latest Future Fit Networking Event visit Boo-Yah.co.za/futurefit-events

Need a Marketing or Motivational Speaker for your events? Contact CarmenMurray.com

Read Carmen Murray's BizCommunity column to #FutureFit yourself at BizCommunity.com

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard
channel.itunes:subtitle: Let Knowledge be Your Super Power!
channel.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
channel.itunes:summary: From Solid Gold Studios welcome to The Carmen Murray Show
channel.itunes:keywords: Carmen Murray, Boo-Yah, innovation, alchemist, future-fit yourself, #FutureFit, #BookFit, #TrendFit, AI, marketing, mobile, speaker, Solid Gold podcast, Gavin Kennedy, #BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: #TrendFit | Rise of the African Barista | Khumo Theko
item.itunes:subtitle: Urban Tribes and the Township Coffee Culture
item.description:
Khumo Theko, researcher and cultural identity trend spotter at Flux Trends, draws attention to the rise of the township investor tribe that are categorised as the New Urban Tribes. She unpacks the rise of the growing ""coffee culture"" in various townships. To learn more about the "New Urban Tribes and the Township Investor: The African Barista", visit Flux Trends

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah.co.za

For additional reading material, you can follow Carmen Murray's Column #FutureFit Yourself on BizCommunity.com

For any inquiries, or requests to appear on the show, you can contact hello@carmenmurray.com for more information.

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Audition Crasher | Kimberleigh Stark
item.itunes:subtitle: Carmen Murray "crashed" one of Kimberleigh Stark's auditions to find new actors and this is what she discovered.
item.description:
Carmen Murray is curious to see what happens in the world of "Kimberleigh Stark" and ambushed one of her auditions in pursuit to find new actors in South Africa. She wanted to have an understanding of what happens behind the scenes of Lights, Cameras, Action in preparation of the Future Fit Networking Events launch, powered by Boo-Yah! At the launch, the theme will be Storytelling and Kimberleigh will unpack storytelling secrets from the Hollywood Playground at this event, and Carmen wanted to see what the fuss was all about in order for her to share the "Behind The Scenes" of her day to day job. What she discovered was an eye-opener. Actors can't bring a bad story to life but give them a good story and you go on an emotional rollercoaster. Listen to this episode to learn more about #BehindTheScenes.

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah.co.za

For additional reading material, you can follow Carmen Murray's Column #FutureFit Yourself on BizCommunity.com

For any inquiries, or requests to appear on the show, you can contact hello@carmenmurray.com for more information.

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: #SalesFit | How to prospect like a Pro | Mark Keating (CEO Sales Guru)
item.itunes:subtitle: The passionate, humorous, legendary and charasmatic Mark Keating, CEO of Sales Guru, shares his valuable blueprint for successful selling.
item.description:
Carmen Murray sit down with the passionate, humorous, legendary and charasmatic Mark Keating, (CEO of Sales Guru, Top Sales Management Training and Keynote Speaker), to give the blue print for successful selling. He has built a phenomenal business focussed on one thing: to help South Africa's salespeople embrace professionalism and great selling practices to help businesses grow. In this episode Carmen and Mark unpacks the dreaded sales calls and the art of getting meetings and how to waste less time on unqualified leads. He teaches us the secrets of his "Boiler room" environment in London and gives us real world tips. Some people thrive by picking up the phone and calling a stranger to get a meeting and others absolutely hate it. Let's face it, cold calling is not for everyone. The only way your business will succeed is by doing sales the right way. When we try and get meetings do we hide behind emails? Is there a better way of writing an email and still yield results? Reaching out to someone on LinkedIn? What is the best way to cold call, be respectful, and land that meeting that could change your life? Mark Keating and Carmen Murray Role Plays some scenarios how to and unpack prospecting in detail to give the audiences an understanding of the right way and the wrong way of prospecting. This episode was so successful, that we decided to bring you a series of #SalesFit episodes to Future Fit your business by building a healthy pipeline, how to rebuttal, diagnose and set your business up for success.

Find out more about our guest Mark Keating and his business Sales Guru

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah.co.za

For additional reading material, you can follow Carmen Murray's Column #FutureFit Yourself on BizCommunity.com

For any inquiries, or requests to appear on the show, you can contact hello@carmenmurray.com for more information.

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: #TrendFit | Bad Big Brother Seeds | Bronwyn Williams
item.itunes:subtitle: The good and bad seeds sowed by organisations will either blossom or die. The Big Brother Brand becomes the Judge, the Jury, the Priest and the Executioner.
item.description:
Bronwyn Williams draws attention to the practice of the 'Big Brother Brands' and the consequences the good and the bad seeds could lead to in the 21st century. She unpacks censorship, propaganda, purpose and forecasts the rise of 'Clean Tech'.

Bronwyn recently spoke at #BizTrends2019

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah.co.za

item.title: #TrendFit | Why Innovation Fails | Dion Chang
item.itunes:subtitle: Dion Chang from Flux Trends explores why brands can't get innovation right, following his trip to Silicone Valley.
item.description:
Dion Chang draws attention to a trend that needs a lot of TLC - Innovation. The success of Innovation requires scaling, and he touches on the daunting task that requires businesses to review, in order to make way for great innovation.

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: How do you protect your ideas? | Marnus Broodryk, Shannon McLaughlin, Roy Taberer, Kimberleigh Stark
item.itunes:subtitle: What SMEs can learn from Ubuntu Baba's clash with Woolworths
item.description:
In this episode Carmen Murray interviews victims of corporate bullying (Shannon Mclaughlan - Ubuntu Baba) and (Kimberleigh Stark - Stark Raving SA). Carmen Murray invited Marnus Broodryk, (Shark Tank South Africa, SME Investor, KykNet's Winslyn Hustler) and patent attornty, Roy Taberer, to weigh in on idea stealing and how SMEs can protect the future of their businesses. What are their rights? Is the law for SMEs or against them? What lessons can we learn from this? There was an incident in South Africa, specifically around a small Business owner, Shannon McLaughlin of Ubuntu Baba, who had to stand up to the retail giant, Woolworths, after she discovered that her original design was copied and even sold under the same name. Many South Africans got behind this story and reprimanded Woolworths for their unethical practice. The reality is, it is not the first time - this happens every day. This is a very informative session discussing Product, Marketing and Advertising, Technology, Film and TV.

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah

For additional reading material, you can follow Carmen Murray's Column #FutureFit Yourself on BizCommunity.com

For any inquiries, or requests to appear on the show, you can contact hello@carmenmurray.com for more information.

Visit Ubuntu Baba for the (baby) support you need.

Thanks to DotSlashMusic for the wonderful track First Sunrise of Spring

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: #BookFit | Swimming with Sharks | Gavin Moffat
item.itunes:subtitle: A book about the simple business guidelines for a complex world by author Gavin Moffat.
item.description:
In this episode, Carmen Murray sits down with Author Gavin Moffat, the Author of Swimming with Sharks. Gavin has worked with companies that have hit Silicon Valley, international brands, one-man outfits, and fledgling small businesses. These businesses each have their unique natures, as though they are living coral reefs, "Moffat ads. He spent nearly three decades helping leaders build their business, plan their growth, and engage with their audiences. About the Book: Drowning in the business deep? This book is the line you need, packaged in quick, bite-sized reference points. Gavin Moffat uses his passion for Scuba Diving to navigate the reader through the complex business world, using powerful analogies, providing point guidelines to empower any business. It is a pocket guide packed with nuggets and gems. In this interview, we talk about Customer Experience, Beta Culture, change of management style, consultants that sucks and those that make a good consultant and much more.

If you would like to purchase the book by Gavin Moffat, you can visit exclusivebooks.co.za or reach out to hello@carmenmurray.com for more information.

To book your ticket to the #FutureFit Networking Events in Johannesburg, please visit Boo-Yah

For additional reading material, you can follow Carmen Murray's Column #FutureFit Yourself on BizCommunity.com

Thanks to DotSlashMusic for the wonderful track First Sunrise of Spring

another Solid Gold podcast

#BeHeard

item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.title: Growing your own Greatness | Pepe Marais
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn about Pepe's raw story and how a misfit grows one of the most successful advertising agencies in South Africa.
item.description:
We sit down and chat with author of the ‘must read’ book of the year : Growing Greatness. Pepe’s latent talent for art was developed and honed at an art school in Cape Town, where he finished top of his class each year, which in turn led him to discover his passion for advertising. After 6 years in the industry he, and his business partner Gareth Leck, launched their enterprising Take-Away Advertising Agency and success seemed a foregone conclusion. However in 2006, Pepe’s business career and personal life began to disintegrate. at the lowest point of his life, he would discover a fundamental insight that became the foundation on which he would rebuild everything. It would also inspire the development of his purpose for Business methodology and his deep interest in unlocking both human and business potential. Growing Greatness contains many lessons for aspiring entrepreneurs, perhaps what is more important is the deep wisdom it offers. He gives us deep wisdom to decode the methodology to reach your full potential in business and as an individual.

For more episodes, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/carmenmurray

item.title: Smarter ways to disrupt you | Timothy Maurice Webster
item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.itunes:subtitle: Timothy Maurice Webster joins Carmen Murray for a fun and inspiring discussion about life, evolving yourself and the importance of The Brain and Brand Science to develop your own personal brand intelligence.
item.description:
Timothy Maurice Webster, Author, Radio Host, TV Presenter, Podcaster, columnist, International Speaker, Brain and Brand expert, introduces bold thinking that questions the value of personal branding and how to navigate the complexity of measuring your identity in varying leadership environments. Like EQ/Emotional Intelligence, PBQ is a way to create heightened awareness of your personal brand potential that shares research, case studies and Timothy’s personal experience with leaders and influencers around the world. Learn more on Www.timothymaurice.com

For more episodes, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/carmenmurray

item.title: Where the ‘bot’ is my ‘voice’? | Godfrey Parkin
item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.itunes:subtitle: I chat to Godfrey Parkin about bots, voice and experimenting with AI which turns out to be fun and affordable.
item.description:
Do you think bots are everything? Turns out it’s about to evolve into something very different? Godfrey gives us some useful tips how we can experiment with AI and voice. We demonstrate some real voice interactions that will give you goosebumps. You won’t be able to tell the difference.

For more episodes, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/carmenmurray

item.title: Let’s get Social | Arthur Goldstuck
item.itunes:author: Carmen Murray | Solid Gold Studios
item.itunes:subtitle: Insights from the annual Social Media Landscape for 2019.
item.description:
Carmen Murray (with her assistant Alexa) sits down with the legendary Arthur Goldstuck to unpack some of the insights from his Annual Social Media report. They take a look at the growth of social media and discuss the controversy of all the social media scandals and ethos matters that should concern social media users. Arthur also shares how a young Free State boy from a small town becomes the leader in Technology Research.

For more episodes, visit SolidGoldStudios.co.za/carmenmurray
